unnormalised: The race for admissions into India's top engineering colleges is heating up. Last date for JEE Main registrations is fast approaching on 15/12/2024. Aspirants are scrambling to fill out forms before the deadline. Competition remains intense, especially for coveted seats at IIT Bombay and IIT Delhi.
normalised: The race for admissions into India's top engineering colleges is heating up. Last date for J-E-E Main registrations is fast approaching on fifteenth December two thousand and twenty four. Aspirants are scrambling to fill out forms before the deadline. Competition remains intense, especially for coveted seats at I-I-T Bombay and I-I-T Delhi.

unnormalised: Initial trends suggest a surge in applicants this year. Experts attribute this to increased awareness and aggressive marketing campaigns by coaching centers. Many students are also opting for online coaching to prep for the JEE, costing anywhere from Rs. 20,000 to â‚¹50,000. Concerns remain about the accessibility of quality coaching for students from rural areas.
normalised: Initial trends suggest a surge in applicants this year. Experts attribute this to increased awareness and aggressive marketing campaigns by coaching centers. Many students are also opting for online coaching to prep for the J-E-E, costing anywhere from rupees twenty thousand to rupees fifty thousand. Concerns remain about the accessibility of quality coaching for students from rural areas.

unnormalised: This year, CBSE Class 12 marks will play a significant role in the admission process. Several state boards have declared their results, with an average of 85% pass percentage. However, a higher percentage does not guarantee a seat as the cutoff scores for some IIT courses are expected to be above 98%. Cutoff scores are projected to be high, making it crucial for students to score well.
normalised: This year, C-B-S-E Class twelve marks will play a significant role in the admission process. Several state boards have declared their results, with an average of eighty five percent pass percentage. However, a higher percentage does not guarantee a seat as the cutoff scores for some I-I-T courses are expected to be above ninety eight percent. Cutoff scores are projected to be high, making it crucial for students to score well.

unnormalised: The counseling process will begin in July'25 after the JEE Advanced results are out. This year, a total of 1.5 lakh seats are available across all IITs, NITs and other government engineering colleges. Good luck to all the aspirants!
normalised: The counseling process will begin in July two thousand and twenty five after the J-E-E Advanced results are out. This year, a total of one point five lakh seats are available across all I-I-T-s, N-I-T-s and other government engineering colleges. Good luck to all the aspirants!
